messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kirby arch re:throwing things
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/02 8:46:18 AM, hazy_lilly@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/02 8:46:18 AM, hazy_lilly@... writes:

<< By any chance is Kirby they little pink puffball from
the nintendo 64? Darn that little pink puffball LOL
(if it is who I think it is LOL) >>

Yes.

My son was named after my dad, Kirby Adams.
THEN he became a Nintendo freak.
THEN Nintendo came out with a character named Kirby. <g>

Marty's the archer. Kirby is the karate guy. Both of them would probably
enjoy being able to inhale things and spoot them out on bad guys (which the
little pink character does <g>).

<<I want to get my son an archery set. He is seven. My
husband said he was to young wait until he is eight.
How old is your son? It sounds like he focuses his
energy.>>

Thirteen.

For general physical release when I was a kid and frustrated, I always like
riding my bike, coasting down hills, riding up to roads with more trees, or
on dirt roads down toward the river. It satisfied the physical movement need
AND it got me away from the house.

Sandra
